aliusmodi: <entryFree id="n1897" type="main" key="a^li_usmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălīus-mŏdi</orth> (better written separately) [2. alius-modus], <sense id="n1897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of another kind</hi>: res alius modi est ac putatur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 6, 21</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">alio modo</hi>, B. and K.): quem alius modi atque omnes natura finxit, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 694</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">alius modi isti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aliusvis: <entryFree id="n1898" type="spur" key="a^li^usvi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭus-vīs</orth>, a false read. for alium iis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl> B. and K.</entryFree>
aliuta: <entryFree id="n1899" type="main" key="a^li^u_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălĭūta</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (orig. <sense id="n1899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> of aliutum, a lengthened form for aliud; like actutum, astutus, etc.; cf. Sanscr. anyathā, aliter), <hi rend="ital">in another manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>: aliuta antiqui dicebant pro aliter .... Hinc est aliud in legibus Numae Pompilii: SEI. QVIS. ALIVTA. FAXIT., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 6</bibl> Müll. (ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 10</bibl>, v. Fleck.).</sense></entryFree>
allabor: <entryFree id="n1900" type="main" key="alla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lābor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n1900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glide to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slide</hi>, and the like; constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>—oftenest in Verg.— <cit><quote lang="la">or in more elevated prose): viro adlapsa sagitta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama adlabitur aurīs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 474</bibl></cit>: Curetum adlabimur oris, <hi rend="ital">we land upon</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 131</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 569</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare crescenti adlabitur aestu,</quote> <trans><tr>rolls up with increasing wave</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlapsus genibus,</quote> <trans><tr>falling down at his knees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 666" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 666</bibl></cit>.—In prose: umor adlapsus extrinsecus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues duo ex occulto adlapsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allaboro: <entryFree id="n1901" type="main" key="alla^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lăbōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (only twice in Hor.), <sense id="n1901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to labor or toil at a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore adlaborandum est tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—And with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to add to with labor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplici myrto nihil adlabores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allacrimo: <entryFree id="n1902" type="main" key="alla_^cri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lā^crĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), also <orth extent="full" lang="la">allā^cry-mo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, or as <sense id="n1902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> -or, āri, <hi rend="ital">to weep at a thing</hi> (only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">Juno adlacrimans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertim adlacrimans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 239</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
allaevo: <entryFree id="n1903" type="main" key="allaevo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allaevo</orth>, v. 2. allēvo.</entryFree>
allambo: <entryFree id="n1904" type="main" key="allambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lambo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (only postclass.), <sense id="n1904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to lick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virides adlambunt ora cerastae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, p. 63</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come in contact with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlambentes flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allapsus: <entryFree id="n1905" type="main" key="allapsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allapsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of allabor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1906" type="main" key="allapsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allapsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>allabor</etym>, <sense id="n1906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gliding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a silent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stealthy approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allatro: <entryFree id="n1907" type="main" key="alla_^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lā^tro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n1907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bark at;</hi> not used before the Aug. per., and trop. of persons, <hi rend="ital">to assail with harsh words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rail at;</hi> and of the sea, <hi rend="ital">to break upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or dash against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the shore</hi> (the simple verb seems to be used for this in the lit. sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 49:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 49, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. latro): Cato adlatrare Africani magnitudinem solitus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlatres licet usque nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:61" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 61</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:292" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oram tot maria adlatrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allatus: <entryFree id="n1908" type="main" key="alla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of adfero.</entryFree>
allaudabilis: <entryFree id="n1909" type="hapax" key="allauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-laudābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>allaudo</etym>, <sense id="n1909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of praise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedisti operam adlaudabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
allaudo: <entryFree id="n1910" type="hapax" key="allaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allaudo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to extol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to praise much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium adlaudat meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allectatio: <entryFree id="n1911" type="hapax" key="allecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>allecto</etym>, <sense id="n1911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enticing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alluring</hi>: Chrysippus nutricum illi quae adhibetur infantibus adlectationi suum carmen (<hi rend="ital">a nursery song</hi>) adsignat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 32</bibl> Halm (Ruhnk. proposed lallationi; cf. Spald. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
allectio: <entryFree id="n1912" type="main" key="allecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>allicio</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n1912.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A choice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">election for something</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a levying of troops</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Anton. Phil. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 12</bibl>; Capell. 1, p. 2.— </sense><sense id="n1912.1" n="II" level="1"> In the lang. of civilians. <hi rend="ital">a promotion to</hi> <pb n="93" /> <cb n="ALLE" /> <hi rend="ital">a higher office before one has performed the duties of a lower</hi>: adlectionis quaerendus est honos, Cod. Th. 6, 4, 10; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:97" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allecto: <entryFree id="n1913" type="main" key="allecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n1913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entice</hi> (prob. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad agrum fruendum non modo non retardat, verum etiam invitat atque adlectat senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves sibilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allector: <entryFree id="n1914" type="main" key="allector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that entices</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allures</hi>: turdi quasi adlectores sint captivorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1915" type="gloss" key="allector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. allĕgo</etym>. <sense id="n1915.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One that chooses others into a college</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 779</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2406</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1915.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A deputy under the emperors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who collected the taxes in the provinces</hi>, Inscr Orell. 369; 3654.</sense></entryFree>
allectura: <entryFree id="n1916" type="gloss" key="allectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of an</hi> allector, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 375, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allectus: <entryFree id="n1917" type="main" key="allectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. allĕgo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n1918" type="main" key="allectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of allicio.</entryFree>
allegatio: <entryFree id="n1919" type="main" key="alle_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. allēgo</etym>. <sense id="n1919.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sending</hi> or <hi rend="ital">despatching to</hi> any one (in the class. per. only twice in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum sibi omnes ad istum adlegationes difficiles viderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 136</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a pun: quibus adlegationibus illam sibi legationem expugnavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1919.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n1919.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an alleging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adducing by way of proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>, and the like: <cit><quote lang="la">si maritus uxorem ream faciat, an lenocinii adlegatio repellat maritum ab accusatione?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:60" default="NO">23, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 241, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1919.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in the Lat. of the jurists, <hi rend="ital">an imperial rescript</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 37.</sense></entryFree>
allegatus: <entryFree id="n1920" type="main" key="alle_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instigating to a deceit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi> (cf. 1. allego, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">meo adlegatu venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allego: <entryFree id="n1921" type="main" key="alle_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lēgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n1921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send one away with a commission</hi> or <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commission</hi> (of private business, while <hi rend="ital">legare</hi> is used in a similar signif. of State affairs; most freq. in Plaut.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare, but class.): ne illi aliquem adlegent, qui mi os occillet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit> (cf. delegare, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 67 and 83); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego si adlegāssem aliquem ad hoc negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium ego isti rei adlegabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos adlegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:57:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 57, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nobiles adlegat iis, qui peterent, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlegarem te ad illos, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: cum patrem primo adlegando, deinde coram ipse rogando fatigāsset, <hi rend="ital">first by the friends sent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and then by personal entreaties</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11, 1</bibl> Gron. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgāti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">deputies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter adlegatos Oppianici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1921.1" n="B" level="2"> Sometimes in the sense of subornare, <hi rend="ital">to instigate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incite one to</hi> an act of fraud or deceit: <cit><quote lang="la">eum adlegaverunt, suum qui servum diceret cum auro esse apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: ut ne credas a me adlegatum hunc senem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 28</bibl> Ruhnk.; cf. allegatus.—</sense><sense id="n1921.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc senatui adlegandum putasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 70</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priorem se petitum ab Alexandro adlegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 224</bibl>.—And in a zeugma: (legati) munera, preces, mandata regis sui adlegant, <hi rend="ital">they bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offer the gifts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreaties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mandates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem et per incensum deprecationem adlegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 21</bibl></cit>: adlegare se ex servitute in ingenuitatem, a legal phrase, <hi rend="ital">to release one's self from servitude by adducing reasons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proofs</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1922" type="main" key="alle^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĕgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ēgi, ectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to select for</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> (qs. ad se legere; like adimere, = ad se emere); <hi rend="ital">to admit by election</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to elect to</hi> a thing, or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> (a corporation; in the class. per. generally only in the histt.): Druidibus praeest unus ... hoc mortuo, si sunt plures pares, suffragio Druidum adlegitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl> Herz. (Dinter here omits adlegitur): <cit><quote lang="la">augures de plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo praetoribus adlecti duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in sui custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter patricios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>: in clerum,<cb n="ALLE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1</bibl>, n. 34 al.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlegi caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 804" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 804</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a. Subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n1922.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A member chosen into any corporation</hi> (collegium): collegae, qui unā lecti, et qui in eorum locum suppositi, sublecti; <cit><quote lang="la">additi Adlecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n1922.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Those who were added to the Senate from the equestrian order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of the small number of the Senators</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were called</hi> adlecti, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allegoria: <entryFree id="n1923" type="greek" key="alle_go^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n1923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allegory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a figurative representation of a thought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of an abstract truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under an image carried through to the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus (usus comparationis) in allegoriam et aenigmata exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt per allegoriam dicta,</quote> <trans><tr>are spoken allegorically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allegoriarum explanationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 186</bibl></cit> (in Cic. written in Greek, Or. 27, 94; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
allegoricus: <entryFree id="n1924" type="greek" key="alle_go^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgoriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n1924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">allegorical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, p. 186</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgŏrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">allegorically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 183</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Aug. ad Genes. tit. 4, 28.</sense></entryFree>
allegorizo: <entryFree id="n1925" type="main" key="alle_go^ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēgŏrīzo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgore/w</foreign>, <sense id="n1925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allegorize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak in allegories</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61</bibl> ad Pamm. 3.</sense></entryFree>
alleluja: <entryFree id="n1926" type="main" key="alle_lu_ja"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allēlūja</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos> <etym>Heb. <foreign /> = praise ye Jehovah</etym> (the sec. syll. is short in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 72</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:104:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 104, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:19:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 19, 1 al.</bibl></entryFree>
allenimentum: <entryFree id="n1927" type="hapax" key="alle_ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lēnīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lenio</etym>, <sense id="n1927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothing remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allevamentum: <entryFree id="n1928" type="hapax" key="alle^va_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĕvāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. allĕvo</etym>, <sense id="n1928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of alleviating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo remedio atque adlevamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
allevatio: <entryFree id="n1929" type="main" key="alle^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĕvātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n1929.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A raising up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerorum adlevatio atque contractio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1929.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an alleviating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (doloris) diuturnitatem adlevatio consoletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam adlevationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allevator: <entryFree id="n1930" type="hapax" key="alle^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĕvātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lifts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raises up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36</bibl></cit> (after the Heb. <foreign />).</sense></entryFree>
allevio: <entryFree id="n1931" type="main" key="alle^vio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĕvio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lĕvis</etym>, = allĕvo, <sense id="n1931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten.</hi> </sense><sense id="n1931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (navis) alleviaretur ab eis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jonas, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 27, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1931.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alleviabit eum Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. Const. 13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. Const. 13</bibl></cit>.—Spec.: <cit><quote lang="la">alleviata est terra Zabulon,</quote> <trans><tr>is dealt lightly</tr>, <tr>leniently with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allevo: <entryFree id="n1932" type="main" key="alle^vo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĕvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. lĕvo</etym>. <sense id="n1932.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi> (in the ante-Aug. per. very rare, perh. only twice in Sall. and Hirt.; later often, esp. in Quint. and the histt.): quibus (laqueis) adlevati milites facilius ascenderent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 2</bibl>: pauci elevati scutis, <hi rend="ital">borne up on their shields</hi> (others: adlevatis scutis, <hi rend="ital">with uplifted shields</hi>, viz. for protection against the darts of the enemy), Auct. B. Alex. 20: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidos complexibus adlevat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubito adlevat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:343" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves turribus atque tabulatis adlevatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia adlevare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta\s o)fru=s a)naspa=n</foreign>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 36, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem alicujus manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>: adlevavit eum, <hi rend="ital">lifted him up</hi> (of the lame man), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 3, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n1932.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n1932.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alleviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi> physical or mental troubles; or, referring to the individual who suffers, <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">console</hi> (class.): aliorum aerumnam dictis adlevans, old poet in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl> (cf. Sophocl. Fragm. ap. Brunck. p. 588: <foreign lang="greek">*kalw=s kakw=s pra/ssonti sumparaine/sas</foreign>): ubi se adlevat, ibi me adlevat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allevat Dominus omnes, qui corruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:144:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 144, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejecistis eos, dum adlevarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 72, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus, aliquā ex parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlevor cum loquor tecum absens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: adlevare corpus, id. <cb n="ALLI" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 31</bibl>: adlevor animum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1932.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To diminish the force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weight</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lighten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversariorum confirmatio diluitur aut infirmatur aut adlevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:42:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 42, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlevatae notae,</quote> <trans><tr>removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n1932.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To raise up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make distinguished; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar eloquentiā et spiritu et jam consulatu adlevabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n1933" type="main" key="alle_vo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lēvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">al-laevo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n1933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smooth off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (only in Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">nodos et cicatrices adlevare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea plaga uno vestigio adlevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allex: <entryFree id="n1934" type="hapax" key="allex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to Isid. Gloss., <sense id="n1934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the great toe;</hi> hence, in derision, of a little man: <cit><quote lang="la">tune hic amator audes esse, allex viri?</quote> <trans><tr>thou thumb of a man</tr>, <tr>thumbling?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n1935" type="main" key="allex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allex</orth> = alec, q. v.</entryFree>
allia: <entryFree id="n1936" type="main" key="Alli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Allĭa</orth> (more correct than <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alĭa</orth>; cf. Wagner, Orthogr. Vergil. p. 415 sq.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n1936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little river eleven miles northwards from Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Crustumerium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the country of the Sabines</hi>, passing through a wide plain (cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 520; Müll. Roms Camp. 1, 138; 141 sq.); it was made memorable by the terrible defeat of the Romans by the Gauls A. U. C. 365, XV. Kal. Sextil. (18 July).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alliensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> Allia: dies, <hi rend="ital">of this battle</hi>, considered ever after as a dies nefastus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37</bibl>-39; 6, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 717</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 408</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
alliatum: <entryFree id="n1937" type="hapax" key="alli^a_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>allium</etym>, orig. <pos>adj.</pos>, sc. edulium, <sense id="n1937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of food composed of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">seasoned with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garlic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me alliato fungi fortunas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allicefacio: <entryFree id="n1938" type="main" key="alli^ce^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭcĕfăcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>alliciofacio</etym>, = allicio, <sense id="n1938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure</hi> (only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod invitat ad se et adlicefacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">viros ad societatem imperii adlicefactos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
allicio: <entryFree id="n1939" type="main" key="alli^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>lexi, lectum, 3</itype> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 217</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 364</bibl> P., also adliceo, ēre, <sense id="n1939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> allicui, Piso ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 877</bibl> P., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 7</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n1939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw to</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">to attract</hi> (in Cic. freq., elsewhere rare; <cit><quote lang="la">never in Ter., Hor., or Juv.): Si magnetem lapidem dicam, qui ferrum ad se adliciat et attrahat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: rex sum, si ego illum hodie hominem ad me adlexero, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 58</bibl>: adlicit aurīs, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 183</bibl> (Lachm. here reads <hi rend="ital">adficit</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">adlicere ad misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris officiis benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 182</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlicere hominum mentes dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Orat. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: quae adliciant animum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adliciunt somnos tempus motusque merumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:681" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comibus est oculis adliciendus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidas nocturno frigore pestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allido: <entryFree id="n1940" type="main" key="alli_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-līdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>, <sense id="n1940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> another. </sense><sense id="n1940.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tetra ad saxa adlidere, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 14</bibl>: ut si quis, prius arida quam sit Cretea persona, adlidat pilaeve trabive, <hi rend="ital">who dashes an image of clay against a post</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 298</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 572</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(remigum) pars ad scopulos adlisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:136:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 136, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latus adlisis clupeis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 627</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl>; cf. Schneid. ad h. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 9, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1940.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring into danger; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffer damage</hi> (the figure taken from a shipwreck; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">affligo): in quibus (damnationibus) Servius adlisus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerunt, si fundus praevaleat, adlidi dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alliensis: <entryFree id="n1941" type="main" key="Alliensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Alliensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Allia.</entryFree>
allifae: <entryFree id="n1942" type="main" key="Alli_fae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīfae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Alīphae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Allīphae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alīfa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/allifai</foreign>, <sense id="n1942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a pleasant valley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the left bank of the Vulturnus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early colonized by the Romans</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tria oppida in potestatem venerunt, Allifae, Callifae, Rubrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38</bibl>; 22, 18; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 789.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīfānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Alīph-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> <pb n="94" /> <cb n="ALLI" /> <hi rend="ital">Allifœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager Allifanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum (in high estimation among the Romans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:526" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 526</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīfāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. calices), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīfāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. pocula), <hi rend="ital">large-sized drinking-cups made there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 39</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīfāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Allifœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alligamentum: <entryFree id="n1943" type="main" key="alli^ga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭgāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>alligo</etym>, = alligatura: pisces habent inter se adligamentum luteum continens usque ad priores pedes, Schol. ad Germ. Arat. 240; v. Hygin. Astronom. 3, 29.</entryFree>
alligatio: <entryFree id="n1944" type="main" key="alli^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n1944.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A binding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tying to</hi> (only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbustorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n1944.1" n="II" level="1"> Abstr. pro concr., <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alligator: <entryFree id="n1945" type="main" key="alli^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭgātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who binds to</hi> (only in Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">adligatoris cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:1" default="NO">4, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:4" default="NO">4, 26, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alligatura: <entryFree id="n1946" type="main" key="alli^ga_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭgātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n1946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 209" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alligo: <entryFree id="n1947" type="main" key="alli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n1947.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind to</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">ad statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad palum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 28</bibl></cit>, § 71; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the witticism of Cic.: Quis generum meum ad gladium adligavit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones adligati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13</bibl></cit>. —In Col. of binding the vine to trees or other supports, 4, 13; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1947.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39</bibl></cit>. So of the binding up of wounds: vulnus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adligatum vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus adligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>.—Of the binding of the hands, feet, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">adliga, inquam, colliga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adligāsset Isaac filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 22, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 21, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adligari se ac venire patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adligetur vinculo ferreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 21, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭgāti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>) (sc. servi), <hi rend="ital">slaves that are fettered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9</bibl>.—Of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">adligare caput lanā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:91" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 91</bibl></cit>: adligat (naves) ancora, <hi rend="ital">makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">holds fast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 169</bibl>.—In Plin. of fixing colors, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fast</hi>: (alga) ita colorem adligans, ut elui postea non possit, 32, 6, 22, § 66; 9, 38, 62, § 134.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac adligatum,</quote> <trans><tr>curdled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:64" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain;</hi> or in a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oblige</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay under obligation</hi> (cf. obligo; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq., but in the class. per. for the most part only in more elevated prose): caput suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure jurando adligare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic furti se adligat,</quote> <trans><tr>shows himself guilty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit> (astringit, illaqueat, et obnoxium facit, Don.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo furti se astringet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17</bibl></cit>; for this <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> cf. Roby, § <cit><quote lang="la">1324): adligare se scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adligatus sponsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiis adligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex omnes mortales adligat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo beneficio sed etiam benevolentiae significatione adligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatione adligari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Rosc. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne existiment ita se adligatos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte quā re impediar et adliger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 16 al.</bibl></cit>— With <case>dat.</case> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adligatus es uxori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 7, 39</bibl> (= lege).—* <cit><quote lang="la">Adligatus calculus, in games of chess,</quote> <trans><tr>a piece that cannot be moved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
allino: <entryFree id="n1948" type="main" key="alli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>lēvi, lĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (upon the formation of the <sense id="n1948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> v. Struve, p. 254 sq.; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> adlinire, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Febr. tit. 33; Maj. tit. 8, 1). </sense><sense id="n1948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedaub</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)lei/fw</foreign> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">schedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1948.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attach to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart to</hi>: nulla nota, nullae sordes videbantur his sententiis adlini posse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl>: incomptis (versibus) adlinet atrum signum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 446</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlinere alteri vitia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alliphae: <entryFree id="n1949" type="main" key="Alli_phae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Allīphae</orth>, v. Allifae.</entryFree>
allisio: <entryFree id="n1950" type="hapax" key="alli_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allīsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>allido</etym>, <sense id="n1950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dashing against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a striking upon</hi>: digitorum, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 8.</sense></entryFree>
allisus: <entryFree id="n1951" type="main" key="alli_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of allido.</entryFree>
allium: <entryFree id="n1952" type="main" key="alli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allĭum</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">alium</orth>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 48</bibl> Ritschl, and Corp. Ins. tit. iv. 2070), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)lla=s</foreign>, seasoned meat</etym>, <sense id="n1952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">garlic</hi> (much used for food among the poor). </sense><sense id="n1952.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oboluisti alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; so id. <cb n="ALLU" /> Poen. 5, 5, 34 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> alia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1952.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: atavi nostri cum alium ac saepe eorum verba olerent, tamen optime animati erant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 201, 6</bibl> (where the double trope olere ... animati is worthy of notice).</sense></entryFree>
allivescit: <entryFree id="n1953" type="gloss" key="alli_vescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allīvescit</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>): livere incipit, hoc est lividum fieri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 28</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
allobrox: <entryFree id="n1954" type="main" key="Allo_^brox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Allō^brox</orth>, <itype>ăgis</itype>, and <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Allō^brŏ-ges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n1954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> Allobroga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 214</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">the Allobroges</hi>, in Ptol. <foreign lang="greek">*)allo/bruges</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a warlike people in Gallia Narbonensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the east side of the Rhone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and to the north of l'Isère</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Savoy</hi>, Dép. de l'Isère, and a part of the Dép. de l'Ain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 57 and 91.—The <number>sing.</number> is found only in the poets, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui totiens Ciceronem Allobroga (i. e. barbare loquentem) dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 214</bibl></cit>.—Hence, deriv. <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Allō^brŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Allobrogian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 3 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> Q. Fabius Maximus, as conqueror of the Allobroges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allocutio: <entryFree id="n1955" type="main" key="allo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allŏcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>alloquor</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n1955.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A speaking to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an accosting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an address</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertit adlocutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inchoatā adlocutione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1955.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1955.2" n="A" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">paramuqi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a consoling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comforting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā solatus es adlocutione?</quote> <trans><tr>consoling words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (habebunt) in die agnitionis adlocutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1955.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An inciting to the conflict;</hi> only upon coins, v. Eckh. D. N. V. 6, p. 268.</sense></entryFree>
allocutus: <entryFree id="n1956" type="main" key="allo^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allŏcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of alloquor.</entryFree>
allophylus: <entryFree id="n1957" type="greek" key="allo^phy_^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allŏphȳ^lus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)llo/fulos</foreign>, <sense id="n1957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of another stock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi> (the orig. long <hi rend="ital">y</hi> is shortened in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuerunt eum allophyli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugium allophylorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. ad Eust. 27 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> de S. Fel. Nat. Carm. 8, 23, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alloquium: <entryFree id="n1958" type="main" key="allo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allŏquĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>alloquor</etym>, <sense id="n1958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an address</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi>, etc. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">adloquio leni perlicere homines ad dedendam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam benigno adloquio adjuvabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandioribus adloquiis prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adloquio militem firmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 18</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:18 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 18 al.</bibl>—In Luc., in gen., = colloquium, <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi>: longis producere noctem adloquiis, 10, 174.</sense></entryFree>
alloquor: <entryFree id="n1959" type="main" key="allo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lŏquor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>cūtus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n1959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to speak to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to address</hi>, esp. used in greeting, admonishing, consoling. etc.; hence also, <hi rend="ital">to salute; to exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse; to console</hi> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">paramuqe/omai</foreign>; in the ante-class. and class. per. rare; in Cic. only twice; more freq. from the time of the Aug. poets). </sense><sense id="n1959.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To speak to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to address</hi>: quem ore funesto adloquar? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admones et adloqueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem blande adloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem nemo adloqui vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61</bibl></cit>; so Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 728</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 283</bibl>; 13, 739; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:466 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 466 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum, compositā in magnificentiam oratione, adlocutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlocutus est (eis) linguā Hebraeā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 21, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n1959.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n1959.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To address</hi> the gods in thanksgiving and prayer: <cit><quote lang="la">dis gratias agere atque adloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 232</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">patriam adlocuta maestast ita voce miseriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n1959.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To address</hi>, as a general his troops, <hi rend="ital">to exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ubi consul accepit, sibimetipsi circumeundos adloquendosque milites ratus, Liv, 10, 35: (Alexander) variā oratione milites adloquebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque milites adlocuturo etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n1959.5" n="C" level="2"> In consolation, <hi rend="ital">to speak to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to console</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comfort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlocutum mulieres ire aiunt, cum eunt ad aliquam locutum consolandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adloqui in luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 619" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflictum adloqui caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1029" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 1029</bibl></cit> P. and R.</sense></entryFree>
allubentia: <entryFree id="n1960" type="hapax" key="allu^benti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lŭbentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lubet</etym>, <sense id="n1960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclination to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fondness for</hi>: jam adlubentia proclivis est sermonis et joci, et scitum est cavillum, i. e. voluntas <cb n="ALLU" /> loquendi et jocandi, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 12</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
allubesco: <entryFree id="n1961" type="main" key="allu^besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lŭbesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n1961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [lubet]. </sense><sense id="n1961.1" n="I" level="1"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to be pleasing to</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa basiare volenti promptis saviolis adlubescebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, p. 10</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n1961.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercle vero jam adlubescit (femina) primulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlubescere aquis,</quote> <trans><tr>to find pleasure in</tr>, <tr>to drink with pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alluceo: <entryFree id="n1962" type="main" key="allu_ceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lūceo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n1962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine upon</hi> (very rare); in the lit. signif. only post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n1962.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi aliqui igniculus adluxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis adluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adluxerunt fulgura ejus orbi terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:97:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 97, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n1962.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as <hi rend="ital">v. a.</hi>: faculam adlucere alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">to light a torch for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give an opportunity for</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
allucinatio: <entryFree id="n1963" type="main" key="allu_ci^na_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">allūcĭnātio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">allūcĭnor</orth>, v. aluc-.</entryFree>
alluctor: <entryFree id="n1964" type="main" key="alluctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-luctor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adl-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n1964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to struggle with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> (only in App.): <cit><quote lang="la">dein adluctari et etiam saltare (me) perdocuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adluctantem mihi saevissimam fortunam superāram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alludio: <entryFree id="n1965" type="main" key="allu_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">al-lūdĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (a less emphatic form of alludo), <sense id="n1965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jest with;</hi> only twice in Plaut.: quando adbibero, adludiabo, Stich. 2, 2, 58; and of dogs, <hi rend="ital">to caress: Ad.</hi> Etiam me meae latrant canes? <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> At tu hercle adludiato, Poen. 5, 4, 64.</sense></entryFree>
