R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Ptolemaeus) tum regnabat alter post Alexandream conditam,</quote> <trans><tr>next after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>; so, fortunate puer, tu nunc eris alter ab illo, <hi rend="ital">the second</hi> or <hi rend="ital">next after him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter ab undecimo jam tum me ceperat annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 39</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2015.12" n="b" level="4"> Also with tens, hundreds, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">accepi tuas litteras, quas mihi Cornificius altero vicesimo die reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>on the twenty-second day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit> Manut.: <cit><quote lang="la">anno trecentesimo altero quam condita Roma erat,</quote> <trans><tr>in the three hundred and second year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicesima et altera laedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 466</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.13" n="c" level="4"> So of a number collectively: <cit><quote lang="la">remissarios pedum XII., alteros pedum X.,</quote> <trans><tr>a second ten</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Brutum hos libros alteros quinque mittemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia mille, deinde centum, dein mille altera, dein secunda centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—So with the numeral understood: aurea mala decem misi; <cit><quote lang="la">cras altera (sc. decem) mittam,</quote> <trans><tr>a second ten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2015.14" n="d" level="4"> Unus et alter, unus atque alter, unus alterque, <hi rend="ital">the one and the other.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2015.15" n="(a)" level="5"> For <hi rend="ital">two</hi> (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei(=s kai\ e(/teros</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">unus et alter dies intercesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductus sum tuis unis et alteris litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sub eā versus unus et alter erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 182</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>: unum vel alterum, vel, cum plurimos, tres aut quattuor admittere).— </sense><sense id="n2015.16" n="(b)" level="5"> More freq. of an indef. number, <hi rend="ital">one and another;</hi> and: unusalterve, <hi rend="ital">one or two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Unus et item alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora si quem tibi item unum alterumve diem abstulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus paulo concinnior unus et alter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 74</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illis unus et alter ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:394" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 394</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45</bibl> Schwarz; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis loricae, vix uni alterive cassis aut galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.17" n="e" level="4"> Alterum tantum, <hi rend="ital">as much more</hi> or <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice as much</hi> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/teron tosou=ton</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e(/tera tosau=ta</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi alterum tantum perdundum est, perdam potius quam sinam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altero tanto aut sesqui major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altero tanto longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero tantum alterum adjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 46</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:3 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2015.18" n="f" level="4"> Alteri totidem, <hi rend="ital">as many more</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alteris totidem scribere incipiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 24</bibl></cit> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n2015.19" n="g" level="4"> To mark the similarity of one object to another in qualities, etc., <hi rend="ital">a second</hi>, <hi rend="ital">another</hi> (as in English, <hi rend="ital">a second father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my second self</hi>, and the like). So, </sense><sense id="n2015.20" n="(a)" level="5"> With a proper name, used as an appellative (cf. alius, II. G.): <cit><quote lang="la">Verres, alter Orcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum se Verrem putabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hamilcar, Mars alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.21" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">com. noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me sicut alterum parentem observat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:42 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 42 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2015.22" n="(g)" level="5"> Alter ego, <hi rend="ital">a second self</hi>, of very intimate friends (in the class. per. perh. only in Cic. Ep.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">o( e(tai=ros, e(/teros e)gw/</foreign>, Clem. Al. 450): <cit><quote lang="la">vide quam mihi persuaserim te me esse alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me alterum se fore dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam alterum me reliquissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; Aus. praef. 2, 15.—</sense><sense id="n2015.23" n="(d)" level="5"> Alter idem, <hi rend="ital">a second self</hi>, like <foreign lang="greek">e(/teroi au(toi/</foreign>, Arist. Eth. M. 8, 12, 3 (on account of the singularity of the expression, introduced by tamquam): <cit><quote lang="la">amicus est tamquam alter idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.24" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The one of two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either of two</hi>, without a more precise designation, for alteruter: <cit><quote lang="la">non uterque sed alter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse utrumque, alterum certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius peribimus quam sine alteris vestrūm vivemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rogarem, ut mea de vobis altera amica foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duobus, quorum alterum petis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duobus (quorum necesse est alterum verum), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac si necesse est in alteram errare partem, maluerim etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO">1, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:6 al" default="NO">9, 3, 6 al.</bibl>—Once also with a negative, <hi rend="ital">neither of two</hi>: hos, tamquam medios,<pb n="98" /> <cb n="ALTE" />  nec in alterius favorem inclinatos, miserat rex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.25" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2015.26" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Another</hi> of a class = alius (as opp. to one's self, to another); <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-creature</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o( pe/las</foreign> (so sometimes <foreign lang="greek">e(/teros</foreign>, Xen. Cyr. 2, 3, 17); cf. Ochsn. Eclog. 90 and 458 (alter designates the similarity of two objects; alius a difference in the objects contrasted): SI. INIVRIAM. FAXIT. ALTERI., Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui alterum incusat probri, eum ipsum se intueri oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 84</bibl>: mox dum alterius abligurias bona, quid censes dominis esse animi? Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut malis gaudeant atque ex incommodis Alterius sua ut comparent commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: qui alteris exitium paret, etc., Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil alterius causā facit et metitur suis commodis omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aeque quisque altero delectetur ac se ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientem in errorem alterum inducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cave ne portus occupet alter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit> Schmid.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil obstet tibi, dum ne sit te ditior alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis parturiens cum rogāsset alteram, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec patientem sessoris alterius (equum) primus ascendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo judicas alterum, te ipsum condemnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo quod suum est quaerat, sed quod alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 17: sic in semet ipso tantum gloriam habebit et non in altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gal. 6, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, alter with a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">neg. question and comp.</hi>, as an emphatic expression (mostly ante-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alius, II. H.): scelestiorem nullum illuxere alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem in terrā nullam esse alteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me alter audacior est homo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.27" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the opposite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius factionis principes,</quote> <trans><tr>the leaders of the opposite party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversariae factioni): studiosiorem partis alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n2015.28" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">different</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens te speculo videris alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: abeuntes post carnem alteram (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/teros</foreign>, q. v. L. and S. III.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2015.29" n="D" level="2"> In the lang. of augury, euphem. for infaustus, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpropitious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 6</bibl> (v. L. and S. Gr. Lex. s. v. <foreign lang="greek">e(/teros</foreign>, III. 2.).!*? The <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> alterius commonly serves as <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of alius instead of alīus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 2</bibl>; 28, 37, 6 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:87" default="NO">11, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:22:2" default="NO">12, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:102:3" default="NO">102, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ot. Sap. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 16:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:34:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 34, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:73 al" default="NO">8, 3, 73 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:114:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 114, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 58 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:28 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 28 al.</bibl>—It also stands as correlative to alius: <cit><quote lang="la">alius inter cenandum solutus est, alterius continuata mors somno est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inventum sit ex veris (gemmis) generis alterius in aliud falsas traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 75, § 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 6</bibl> (Neue, Formenl. II. p. 216).!*? ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">altĕras</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>alter</etym>, for alias, acc. to Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
altercabilis: <entryFree id="n2016" type="hapax" key="alterca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altercābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>altercor</etym>, <sense id="n2016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contentious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altercatio: <entryFree id="n2017" type="main" key="alterca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altercātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strife</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contest in words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debate;</hi> either with or without passion: <foreign lang="greek">a)moibai=os lo/gos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. (perh. not entirely dignified, since Cic. uses it several times in his Epistt. and philos. writings; but in his Oratt. <hi rend="ital">disceptatio</hi> and <hi rend="ital">contentio</hi> generally take its place). </sense><sense id="n2017.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: in pauciores avidos altercatio est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies consumptus est altercatione Lentuli consulis et Caninii tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo ad altercationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oritur mihi magna de re altercatio cum Velleio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ibi non disceptatio modo, sed etiam altercatio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 40</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">35, 17: Cn. Domitius collegae suo altercatione ortā objecit, quod etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum altercatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 181" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altercatione barbam invadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2017.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">an altercation;</hi> a kind of discourse in a court of justice, which is not continuous, but where one seeks to vanquish his opponent by interposed questions, sometimes <cb n="ALTE" /> mingled with abuse (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO">4, 1, 28</bibl>, and altercor, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altercator: <entryFree id="n2018" type="main" key="alterca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altercātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>altercor</etym>, <sense id="n2018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orator who strives to conquer his antagonist by interrogatories</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disputant</hi> (cf. altercatio, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonus altercator vitio iracundiae careat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ver. Imper. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ver. Imper. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alterco: <entryFree id="n2019" type="main" key="alterco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alterco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n2019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form for altercor (anteand post-class.), <hi rend="ital">to wrangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrel</hi>: cum patre altercāsti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 28</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, dum de his altercatur, ipsius negotii disceptatio proteletur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Just. 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altercor: <entryFree id="n2020" type="main" key="altercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altercor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>alter</etym>, <sense id="n2020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have a discussion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difference with another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dispute; to wrangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrel</hi>, etc. (constr. cum aliquo, inter se, and alicui with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n2020.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: cur illa hic mecum altercata est? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labienus altercari cum Vatinio incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum ritu inter nos altercantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>.—Once with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum hunc et hujusmodi sermonem altercamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 40</bibl></cit>: nimium altercando veritas amittitur, P. Syr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n2020.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">to strive to gain the victory over an opponent in a court of justice by putting questions for him to answer</hi> (cf. altercatio, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus in altercando invenit parem neminem,</quote> <trans><tr>in crossexamining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen, <hi rend="ital">to contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggle with</hi>: altercante libidinibus pavore, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alterculum: <entryFree id="n2021" type="main" key="alterculum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alterculum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">altercum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n2021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">henbane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (herba) Apollinaris, apud Arabas altercum sive altercangenum, apud Graecos vero hyoscyamus appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 17, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 181" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 181</bibl>.—Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">al-terculum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alterim: <entryFree id="n2022" type="main" key="alte^rim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĕrim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, conjectured by Ritschl in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 123</bibl>, after the analogy of illim, istim, utrimque, olim, v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
alternamentum: <entryFree id="n2023" type="hapax" key="alterna_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alternāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = alternatio, <sense id="n2023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alternation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alternatim: <entryFree id="n2024" type="main" key="alterna_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alternātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>alternatus</etym>, <sense id="n2024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by turns</hi>: gaudium atque aegritudinem alternatim sequi, Claud. Quadrig. Ann. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 76, 11</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
alternatio: <entryFree id="n2025" type="main" key="alterna_ti_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alternātīo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>alterno</etym>, <sense id="n2025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an alternation</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n2025.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: per vices successio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes incertis alternationibus commovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2025.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., t. t. in the jurists, <hi rend="ital">an alternative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this or that</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO">13, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:9" default="NO">11, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alterne: <entryFree id="n2026" type="main" key="alterne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alternē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">alternīs</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">alternă</orth>, <sense id="n2026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. alternus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
alterno: <entryFree id="n2027" type="main" key="alterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alterno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>alternus</etym>: aliquid, <sense id="n2027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do one thing and then another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do a thing by turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interchange with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to alternate</hi> (first in the poets of the Aug. per., later most freq. in Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">alternare vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternant spesque timorque fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>make it at one time credible</tr>, <tr>at another not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundines in fetu summā aequitate alternant cibum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>give to the young their food in succession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:68" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 20, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:554" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:354" default="NO">9, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:60" default="NO">11, 60</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl>.—Without an <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec alternanti potior sententia visa est,</quote> <trans><tr>hesitating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternantes proelia miscent,</quote> <trans><tr>fight by turns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 220</bibl></cit>: arborum fertilitas omnium fere alternat, <hi rend="ital">alternates</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they bear every other year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 7, § 18</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum symphoniā alternāsse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alternus: <entryFree id="n2028" type="main" key="alternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alter</etym>, <sense id="n2028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one after the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchangeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternate</hi> (class. and also <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n2028.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: (<hi rend="ital">Sem</hi>)VNIS. ALTERNEI. ADVOCAPIT. CONCTOS (i. e. Semones alterni advocate cunctos), Carm. Fr. Arv. 36 (v. advoco <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): alternā vice inire, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 151 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">alternae arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alterno tenebras et lucem tempore gigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 978</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duabus orationibus capita alterna recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternis trabibus ac saxis,</quote> <trans><tr>with beams and stones regularly interchanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">(bibere) alternis diebus modo aquam, modo vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alterno terram quatiunt pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per alternas vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix hostem, alterni si congrediamur, habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 121</bibl>: alternum <cb n="ALTI" /> foedus amicitiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:109:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 109, 6</bibl>: alternus metus, <hi rend="ital">mutual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciprocal fear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternas servant praetoria ripas,</quote> <trans><tr>the opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>the eagles which stand opposite to each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mall. Theod. prol. 16</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in its connection): <cit><quote lang="la">alternis paene verbis T. Manlii factum laudans,</quote> <trans><tr>with almost every other word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>: alternis dicetis; <cit><quote lang="la">amant alterna Camenae,</quote> <trans><tr>responsive song</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versibus alternis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: alternis aptum sermonibus, <hi rend="ital">alternate discourse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dialogue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 81</bibl>. —Of verses: <hi rend="ital">interchanging between hexameter and pentameter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes alternos esse oportebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigramma alternis versibus longiusculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere alterno carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 121</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 10</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modos impares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 220</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n2028.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the Roman courts of justice the accused, and afterwards the accuser, could alternately reject all the judges appointed by the prætor; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, alterna consilia or alternos judices reicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject by turns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alternae civitates rejectae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> are not used. —<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> (only in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n2028.3" n="a" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">alter-nē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>, only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n2028.4" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">alternìs</orth> (<hi rend="ital">abl. plur.;</hi> sc. vicibus), <hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by turns</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and prose; freq. in Lucr.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 524</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:768" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 768</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1011" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1011</bibl>; 1, 1066; 3, 373; 4, 790; 6, 570; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n2028.5" n="c" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">alternă</orth>, <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl> Jan; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 8</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
alterplex: <entryFree id="n2029" type="gloss" key="alterplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alterplex</orth>, plĭcis: duplex, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
altertra: <entryFree id="n2030" type="gloss" key="altertra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altertra</orth>: alterutra, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
alteruter: <entryFree id="n2031" type="main" key="alte^ru^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĕr-ŭter</orth>, <itype>altĕrū^tra</itype> (more freq. than altera utra), altĕrū^trum (more freq. than alterum utrum), <pos>adj.</pos> (in the <sense id="n2031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obliq. cas.</hi> arch. alterutrius, alterutri, etc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 667</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">693</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. f.</hi> alterutrae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 132</bibl> ib.). </sense><sense id="n2031.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the one</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either</hi>, no matter which (rare but class.): AD. ALTERVTRVM. SIBI. REDD(<hi rend="ital">iderunt</hi>), Carm. Fr. Arv. 28: <cit><quote lang="la">video esse necesse alterutrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in alterutro peccandum sit, malo viderinimis timidusquam parum prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: Alterutrum velox victoria fronde coronet, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 1</bibl>.—With both parts declined (prob. only in the two foll. exs.): alteriusutrius causā, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 693</bibl> P.: longitudo alteriusutrius, Cic. Prot. Fragm. ib.—</sense><sense id="n2031.2" n="II" level="1"> = uterque, <hi rend="ital">both</hi>: necessarium fuit alterutrum foris et sub dio esse, Col. praef. 12.</sense></entryFree>
alteruterque: <entryFree id="n2032" type="main" key="alteruterque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alteruterque</orth>, <sense id="n2032.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
alterutrimque: <entryFree id="n2033" type="hapax" key="alte^rutrimque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĕr-utrimque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n2033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in both cases</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causā alterutrimque modus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">alterutrāque.</hi></sense></entryFree>
althaea: <entryFree id="n2034" type="greek" key="althaea1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">althaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)lqai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild mallows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marsh-mallows</hi>, = hibiscum; Althaea officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2035" type="main" key="Althaea2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Althaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)alqai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Thestius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Œneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Calydon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Meleager</hi>, whom, in revenge for the death of her brothers slain by him in the Calydonian hunt, she killed, by burning the brand, on the preservation of which his life depended, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 446</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 511</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 531</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 171" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alticinctus: <entryFree id="n2036" type="hapax" key="alti^cinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭcinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-cinctus</etym>, <sense id="n2036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high-girded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi> (cf. accingo, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex alticinctis unus atriensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alticomus: <entryFree id="n2037" type="hapax" key="alti^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [alte-coma); of trees, <sense id="n2037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having foliage high up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the top</hi>: cupressus, Tert. Jud. Dom. c. 8.</sense></entryFree>
altijugus: <entryFree id="n2038" type="hapax" key="alti^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n2038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a lofty summit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Nat. XIII. S. Fel. 660</bibl></cit> Mur.</sense></entryFree>
altilaneus: <entryFree id="n2039" type="main" key="alti^la_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭlāneus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-lana</etym>, <sense id="n2039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick wool</hi>: BERBECES, ARIETES, Fragm. Fr. Arv. ap. Marin. p. 145 and <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1798</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altiliarius: <entryFree id="n2040" type="main" key="alti^li^a_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭlĭārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>altilis</etym>, <sense id="n2040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that fattens</hi> birds, esp. fowls, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2866</bibl>: Inser.<pb n="99" /> <cb n="ALTI" />  Murat. 906, 9; cf. altiliarius: <foreign lang="greek">o)rniqotro/fos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
altilis: <entryFree id="n2041" type="main" key="alti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alo</etym>. <sense id="n2041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2041.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fattened</hi>, esp. of domestic animals (syn. saginatus): <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 56, 56, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium altilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: altilis (sc. avis), <hi rend="ital">a fattened bird</hi>, esp. of fowls: <cit><quote lang="la">satur altilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor altilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:115" default="NO">5, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes altilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ez. 39, 18</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altilia: tauri mei et altilia occisa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2041.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 139</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 220</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 32</bibl>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Of athletae: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 18</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n2041.3" n="C" level="2"> In Plaut. once trop. for <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>: divitiis maximis, dote altili atque opimā, <hi rend="ital">a fat and rich dowry</hi>, Plaut. Cist. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 31</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n2041.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nutritive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altinum: <entryFree id="n2042" type="main" key="Alti_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Altīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/altinon</foreign>, <sense id="n2042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the north of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Venice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the river Silis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the shore of the Adriatic Sea</hi>, distinguished for its fat sheep and magnificent villas; now <hi rend="ital">Altino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:155" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 85, 86.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Altīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Altinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Altīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis, the same</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Altīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altipendulus: <entryFree id="n2043" type="main" key="alti^pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭpendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-pendo</etym>, <sense id="n2043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging high</hi>: aliquot reliquimus altipendulos vindemiae superstites, M. Aur. Ant. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altipeta: <entryFree id="n2044" type="hapax" key="alti^pe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n2044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comm.</hi> [alte-peto], <hi rend="ital">aspiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high-flying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
altipotens: <entryFree id="n2045" type="main" key="alti^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-potens</etym>, <sense id="n2045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of high power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very mighty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, p. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altisonus: <entryFree id="n2046" type="main" key="alti^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-sonus</etym>. <sense id="n2046.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">High-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding from on high</hi> (very rare and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): cardo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 25 Rib.): in altisono caeli clupeo, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 19</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Carm. Div. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 530" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 530</bibl></cit>: maritus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 2, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2046.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublime</hi>: Maro, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:179" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altispex: <entryFree id="n2047" type="main" key="altispex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altispex</orth>, <itype>spĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>alte-specio</etym>, <sense id="n2047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">looking down from a height</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 7</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
altitonans: <entryFree id="n2048" type="main" key="alti^to^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭtŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-tonans</etym>, <sense id="n2048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thundering from on high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater altitonans,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Carm. Div. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in gen., of wind, <hi rend="ital">loud-roaring</hi>: Volturnus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 745</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altitonus: <entryFree id="n2049" type="hapax" key="alti^to^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭtŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-tonus</etym>, = altitonans: flammeae zonae, Varr. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>.</entryFree>
altitudo: <entryFree id="n2050" type="main" key="alti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>dĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>altus</etym>, <sense id="n2050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depth</hi> (cf. alo, <hi rend="ital">p. a. init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n2050.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altitude</hi> (syn.: altum, cacumen, culmen, vertex, apex). </sense><sense id="n2050.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudinem temperato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 37, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac immensitate altitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fore altitudines, quas cepissent hostes (sc. montium),</quote> <trans><tr>heights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2050.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatio atque altitudo orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>greatness of soul</tr>, <tr>nobleness of mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2050.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Depth</hi> (syn.: altum, profundum). </sense><sense id="n2050.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca infinitā altitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2050.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">depth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">O altitudo divitiarum sapientiae et scientiae Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—Spec., <hi rend="ital">depth</hi> of soul, <hi rend="ital">secrecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi>, Gr <foreign lang="greek">baqu/ths</foreign>: exercenda est facilitas et altitudo animi, quae dicitur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a serenity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calmness that conceals the real feelings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad simulanda negotia altitudo ingenii incredibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per illos dies egit altitudine animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudines Satanae,</quote> <trans><tr>deep plots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altiuscule: <entryFree id="n2051" type="main" key="alti^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭuscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. altiusculus.</entryFree>
altiusculus: <entryFree id="n2052" type="main" key="alti^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n2052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [altus], <hi rend="ital">rather high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little too high</hi> (only in the foll. <cb n="ALUC" /> exs.): usus est calceamentis altiusculis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭuscŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat highly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 117, 34 Elm.</sense></entryFree>
altivolans: <entryFree id="n2053" type="main" key="alti^vo^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭvŏlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-volans</etym>, <sense id="n2053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soaring</hi>: genus antivolantum (i. e. aves), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 84 Vahl.): altivolans solis rota, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 433</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altivolus: <entryFree id="n2054" type="hapax" key="alti^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altĭvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alte-volo</etym>, <sense id="n2054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soaring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 19, 21, § 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alto: <entryFree id="n2055" type="main" key="alto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>altus</etym>, <sense id="n2055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> (only in the foll. exs.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol altatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altor: <entryFree id="n2056" type="main" key="altor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>alo</etym>. <sense id="n2056.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a nourisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foster-father</hi>: omnium rerum educator et altor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altore recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 101</bibl></cit>: Curetes altores Jovis, * Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1247" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1247</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:69" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 69</bibl>.—Worshipped as a god, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Fragm. p. 226" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Fragm. p. 226</bibl> Bip.; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n2056.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">nutritious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci altores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altrinsecus: <entryFree id="n2057" type="main" key="altrinse^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altrinsĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for alterim-secus from alter-secus</etym> (ante- and post-class.; ante-class. only in Plaut. in the foll. exs.). <sense id="n2057.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the other side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, malum, adstas? quin retines altrinsecus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 16</bibl>: fenestrae, quae foris (<hi rend="ital">outwardly</hi>) urbem prospiciunt, et altrinsecus (<hi rend="ital">within</hi>) fores, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 41</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl>, p. 122, 39.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2057.1" n="II" level="1"> (Postclass.) <hi rend="ital">From</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, = ab utrāque parte: <cit><quote lang="la">venientes altrinsecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7</bibl>; Treb. Poll. Gall. p. 309; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Prisc. Serm. p. 560, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrasque partes contra se altrinsecus posuit,</quote> <trans><tr>over against each other on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchiola duo altrinsecus (fecit),</quote> <trans><tr>stays on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—Cf. Hand, Turs. I. pp. 282-284.</sense></entryFree>
altrix: <entryFree id="n2058" type="main" key="altrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>altor</etym>, <sense id="n2058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female nourisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustainer</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. alumnus): Calydonia altrix terra exsuperantum virum, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 18</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum eadem terra parens, altrix, patria dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altricem Ulixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 273</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">terra</hi>: altricis extra limen Apuliae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 10</bibl>; so once in Cic.: Romani nominis, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 12, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idā altrice relictā (since Hermaphroditus had been brought up there),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 293</bibl></cit>: Sanguinis altricem non pudet esse lupam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum bellatorumque virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 218</bibl></cit>. —Esp., of <hi rend="ital">a wet-nurse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 683</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:602" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:1:96" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 251" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
altrovorsum: <entryFree id="n2059" type="main" key="altrovorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altrovorsum</orth>, contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">altrorsus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>alter-versum</etym>, <sense id="n2059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the other side</hi>, = ab alterā parte: rerum altrovorsum quom meam mecum rationem puto, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicissimā illā uxore altrorsus disclusā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
altum: <entryFree id="n2060" type="main" key="altum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>altus</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> from alo.</entryFree>
altus: <entryFree id="n2061" type="main" key="altus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, participle from alo., lit., <sense id="n2061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi> (altus ab alendo dictus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl> Müll.; cf. the Germ. <hi rend="ital">gross</hi> with the Engl. <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>), a polar word meaning both <hi rend="ital">high</hi> and <hi rend="ital">deep.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2061.1" n="A" level="2"> Seen from below upwards, <hi rend="ital">high.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2061.2" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: IN ALTOD MARID PVCNANDOD, etc., Columna Duilii; so, maria alta, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P.: aequor, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 23</bibl> Müll.: parietes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ramis arboris altae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:198 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 198 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columellam tribus cubitis ne altiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior illis Ipsa dea est colloque tenus supereminet omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>taller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altis de montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras Altorum nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:591 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 591 al.</bibl></cit>—With the <case>acc.</case> of measure: <cit><quote lang="la">clausi lateribus pedem altis,</quote> <trans><tr>a foot high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 39</bibl></cit> Gerl.; cf. Lind. C. Gr. I. p. 215.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triglyphi alti unius et dimidiati moduli, lati in fronte unius moduli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem turrim altam cubitorum CXX.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta novem pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula latera pedum lata tricenum, alta quinquagenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnanimous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high-minded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">august</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimus dignitatis gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 37</bibl>.—Of mind or thought: <cit><quote lang="la">te natura excelsum quendam videlicet et altum et humana despicientem genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sapiens et altā mente praeditus,</quote> <trans><tr>highminded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui altiore animo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57 al.</bibl></cit>—So of gods, or persons elevated in birth, rank, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">also of things personified: rex aetheris altus Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 875</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas, i. e. deā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:23 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Conclamate iterum altiore voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fatus altā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 196" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimus sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 24</bibl></cit>;
