<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 32</bibl>).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">altum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est hic ordo (senatorius) quasi propositus atque editus in altum,</quote> <trans><tr>on high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia in altum edita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid in altum Fortuna tulit, ruitura levat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 100" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 100</bibl></cit>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n2061.4" n="(a)" level="5"> (Sc. caelum.) <hi rend="ital">The height of heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heavens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto volavit avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:108" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ait, et Maiā genitum demisit ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 297</bibl></cit>.—Still more freq., </sense><sense id="n2061.5" n="(b)" level="5"> (Sc. mare.) <hi rend="ital">The high sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>: rapit ex alto navīs velivolas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sumus provecti in altum, capiunt praedones navem illam, ubi vectus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; so <cb n="ALO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terris jactatus et alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altum Vela dabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collectae ex alto nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urget ab alto Notus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 443</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">alto mersā classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:665" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illā parte urbis navibus aditus ex alto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alto jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves nisi in alto constitui non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in altum provectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: scapha in altum navigat, Sall. Fragm.—So in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta petens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 362</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis te in altum capessis, tam aestus te in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbecillitas ... in altum provehitur imprudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quasi quidam aestus ingenii tui in altum abstraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.6" n="B" level="2"> Seen from above downwards, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profound.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2061.7" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (hence sometimes opp. summus): Acherusia templa alta Orci, salvete, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:2:81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom ex alto puteo sursum ad summum escenderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimae radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae stirpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissima flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta theatri Fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurgite in alto,</quote> <trans><tr>in the deep whirlpool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 857</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 48" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum totā metitur cuspide pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:292" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 292</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:580 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 580 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde altior esset Casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 106</bibl></cit>.—With the <case>abl.</case> of measure: <cit><quote lang="la">faciemus (scrobes) tribus pedibus altas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (more freq. in and after the Aug. per.), <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno quibus est opus alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissima tranquillitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissima eruditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altiores artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">altum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the depth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">what is deep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">far removed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto dissimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex alto venire nequitiam, sed summo, quod aiunt, animo inhaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—Hence, ex alto repetere, or petere, in discourse, <hi rend="ital">to bring from far;</hi> as <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">farfetched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de nostris officiis scripserim, quoniam ex alto repetita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causas petis ex alto?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 395</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alte repetere in the same sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4</bibl>, and v. al. infra).—</sense><sense id="n2061.9" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in reference to a distant (past) time: cur vetera tam ex alto appetissis discidia, Agamemno? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 237, 22</bibl> (altum: vetus, antiquum, Non.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 285</bibl>.—With the access. idea of venerable (cf. antiquus), <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus alto a sanguine Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebanā de matre nothum Sarpedonis alti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 697</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">genus Clauso referebat ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:305" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altā gente satus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:202" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altis inclitum titulis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 338" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 338</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">altē</orth>, and very rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">altum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi> (v. supra, altus, <hi rend="ital">P. a. init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n2061.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">High</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from on high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from above</hi> (v. <itype>altus</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A.). </sense><sense id="n2061.11" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte ex tuto prospectum aucupo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Rel. p. 188" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 188</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">colomen alte geminis aptum cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 221: <cit><quote lang="la">alte jubatos angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:ib. p. 9" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> ib. p. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar erigere alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseā sol alte lampade lucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vineā ficos subradito alte, ne eas vitis scandat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentum alte extollens pugionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: non animadvertis cetarios escendere in malum alte, ut perspiciant pisces? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) tollit se ac rectis ita faucibus eicit alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram Entellus alte extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte suras vincire cothurno,</quote> <trans><tr>high up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer alte cinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda alte subjectat arenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil tam alte natura constituit, quo virtus non possit eniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: alte maesti in terram cecidimus, <hi rend="ital">from on high</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 79, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo calcem cribro succretam indito alte digitos duo,</quote> <trans><tr>to the height of two fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 5, 6, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt humiliora neque se tollere a terrā altius possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollam altius tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius praecincti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus in arvis altius ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput altius effert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius atque cadant imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 38</bibl></cit> ubi v. Forb.: <cit><quote lang="la">altius aliquid tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <pb n="96" /> <cb n="ALOP" /> cum altissime volāsset (aquila), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:379" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 379</bibl></cit> (cf.: altus <itype>Aeneas, supra</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A. II.): <cit><quote lang="la">alte enim cadere non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video te alte spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius se efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius irae surgunt ductori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius aliquid agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">attollitur vox altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis altius atque altius insurgentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ille dies virtutem Catonis altissime illuminavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium altissime adsurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi> (v. <itype>altus</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B.). </sense><sense id="n2061.14" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ablaqueato ficus non alte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum haud alte in corpus descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte vulnus adactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 850</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidum caput abdidit alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte consternunt terram frondes,</quote> <trans><tr>deeply strew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut petivit Suspirium alte!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem gemitum dat pectore ab imo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 485</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">inter cupam pertundito alte digitos primorīs tres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum alte pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:de Arb. 30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> de Arb. 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne radices altius agant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra altius effossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sulcus altius esset impressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus imber Altius ad vivum persedit, Verg G. 3, 441: tracti altius gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(latronibus gladium) altissime demergo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2061.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profoundly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from afar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatus ut altum Dormiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte terminus haerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo et alte petito prooemio respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio alte petita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte et a capite repetis, quod quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui altius perspiciebant,</quote> <trans><tr>had a deeper insight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae principia sint, repetendum altius videtur,</quote> <trans><tr>must be sought out more deeply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius repetitae causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo si paulo altius ordiri ac repetere memoriam religionis videbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hisce tibi in rebus latest alteque videndum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius supprimere iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius aliquem percellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius metuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius animis maerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verbum aliquod altius transfertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Altius omnem Expediam primā repetens ab origine famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 285</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius aliquid persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 31, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc altius cura serpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 13, § 87</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vir et quantus esset, altissime inspexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2062" type="hapax" key="altus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">altus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>alo</etym>, <sense id="n2062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nourishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae altu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
alucinatio: <entryFree id="n2063" type="main" key="a_lu_ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ālūcĭnātĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">all-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hall-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>alucinor</etym>, <sense id="n2063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreaminess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revery</hi> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 20</bibl>, used even by the old writers (veteres); <cit><quote lang="la">but, except in the passage quoted by him from an author not named, it is found only in the foll. exs.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 152</bibl>, and 6, p. 194.</sense></entryFree>
alucinator: <entryFree id="n2064" type="hapax" key="a_lu_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ālūcĭnātor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">all-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hall-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is wandering in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dreamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a silly fellow</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
alucinor: <entryFree id="n2065" type="main" key="a_lu_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ālūcĭnor</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">all-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hall-</orth>; cf. Gron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 3</bibl>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>prob. from <foreign lang="greek">a)lu/w, a)lu/ssw; a)/lh, a)lu/kh</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 3</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n2065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wander in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to talk idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dream</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">aberro, deliro, desipio, insanio): alucinari: aberrare et non consistere, atque dissolvi et obstupefieri atque tardari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 20</bibl></cit> (apparently not used before the time of Cic., yet cf. alucinatio): <cit><quote lang="la">quae Epicurus oscitans alucinatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicor hunc alucinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicium vagi animi et alucinantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: epistolae nostrae debent interdum alucinari,<cb n="ALUT" />  <hi rend="ital">to follow no definite train of thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to digress freely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alucinans pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alucita: <entryFree id="n2066" type="hapax" key="aluci^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alucĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; acc. to Fulg., <sense id="n2066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gnat</hi> = culex: vernales me alucitae molestabant, Petr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 566, 25</bibl> Lips.</sense></entryFree>
alum: <entryFree id="n2067" type="main" key="alum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hal-</orth>), <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">alus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2067.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comfrey</hi>: Symphytum officinale, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 6, 24, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 26, § 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2067.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of garlic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alumen: <entryFree id="n2068" type="main" key="a^lu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Doed., Syn. VI. p. 16, compares <foreign lang="greek">a)/loima a)/leimma</foreign> = unguent</etym>, <sense id="n2068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 183</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alumento: <entryFree id="n2069" type="gloss" key="Alumento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Alumento</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Alumeto</orth> (Lindem.), for Laomedon, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 18</bibl> Müll.; v. Müll. ad h. l.</entryFree>
aluminatus: <entryFree id="n2070" type="main" key="a^lu_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alumen</etym>, <sense id="n2070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tinctured with alum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aluminosus: <entryFree id="n2071" type="main" key="a^lu_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aluminous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of alum;</hi> only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alumna: <entryFree id="n2072" type="main" key="a^lumna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. alumnus, I. B.</entryFree>
alumno: <entryFree id="n2073" type="main" key="a^lumno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălumno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>qs. contr. of alumino, from alo</etym>, <sense id="n2073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puellam prodidit vicinis alumnandam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, p. 182, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 302</bibl>.—In a <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">canes rabidos, quos ad tutelae praesidia curiose fuerant alumnati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 8</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
alumnus: <entryFree id="n2074" type="main" key="a^lumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălumnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. contr. of alomenos, from alo</etym>. <sense id="n2074.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is nourished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought up;</hi> for the most part <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2074.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nursling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foster-son.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2074.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (most freq. in the poets.): desiderio alumnūm ( = alumnorum), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 243, 6</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 116 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">erus atque alumnus tuus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid voveat dulci nutricula majus alumno?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityon, terrae omniparentis alumnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 595</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 524</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with 421: legionum alumnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>brought up in the camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinius sutrinae tabernae alumnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum flevit alumnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:94" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 94</bibl></cit>: alumni hominum peccatorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 32, 14</bibl>.—Of the inhabitants of a country (cf. altrix): <cit><quote lang="la">Italia alumnum suum summo supplicio fixum videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of cattle: Faune, abeas parvis Aequus alumnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n2074.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego itaque pacis, ut ita dicam, alumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>a child of fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, of pupils: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis alumnus,</quote> <trans><tr>pupil</tr>, <tr>disciple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus disciplinae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2074.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foster-daughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra haec alumna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia omnium terrarum alumna eadem et parens (i. e. quae ab aliis terris alitur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam filiam et alumnam praedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidam hortatur alumnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:358" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 358</bibl></cit>.—Of frogs: aquai dulcis alumnae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9, 15</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cana veritas Atticae philosophiae alumna, <hi rend="ital">truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the foster-child of Attic philosophy</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 243, 2</bibl>: jam bene constitutae civitatis quasi alumna quaedam, eloquentia, <hi rend="ital">the foster-child of an already well-ordered state</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cliens et alumna Urbis Ostia (as a colony of the same),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2074.5" n="C" level="2"> The <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen alumnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 421</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2074.6" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who brings up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">educates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygnus alumna stagna petierat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, p. 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence Isidorus: et qui alit et alitur, alumnus dici potest, Orig. 10, 1.</sense></entryFree>
aluntium: <entryFree id="n2075" type="main" key="A^lunti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăluntĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hal-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)alou/ntion</foreign>, Dion. Hal., <foreign lang="greek">*)alo/ntion</foreign> Ptol., <sense id="n2075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the northern part of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from the coast</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Filadelpho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 2, 410.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăluntīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hal-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Aluntium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aluta: <entryFree id="n2076" type="main" key="a^lu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, orig. <pos>adj.</pos> (sc. pellis) [prob. from alumen], <sense id="n2076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soft leather</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">prepared by means of alum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2076.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: alutae tenuiter confectae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2076.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is made of it.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2076.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A shoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2076.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A purse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pouch</hi>: tumidā superbus<pb n="100" /> <cb n="ALVU" />  alutā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:282" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 282</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2076.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A patch put on the face for ornament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alutacius: <entryFree id="n2077" type="main" key="a^lu_ta_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūtācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aluta</etym>, <sense id="n2077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to soft leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26</bibl> (not used elsewhere).</sense></entryFree>
alutarius: <entryFree id="n2078" type="hapax" key="a^lu_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălūtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, = alutacius: <sense id="n2078.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a plaster made of soft leather</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
alvearium: <entryFree id="n2079" type="main" key="alve^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvĕārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in Col. four times <orth extent="full" lang="la">alveāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>) [alveus], a hollow vessel swelling out in the middle.—Hence, <sense id="n2079.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beehive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu lento fuerint alvearia (four syl. per synaeresin) vimine texta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>; * Cic. Oecon. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2079.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beehouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apiary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum villam totam alvearium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2079.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kneading-trough</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alveatus: <entryFree id="n2080" type="hapax" key="alve^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollowed out like a trough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 43, 1</bibl></cit> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
alveolatus: <entryFree id="n2081" type="hapax" key="alve^o^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvĕŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>alveolus</etym>, <sense id="n2081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollowed out like a little tray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channelled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stylobata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alveolus: <entryFree id="n2082" type="main" key="alve^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>alveus</etym>, <sense id="n2082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hollow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cavity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2082.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveolus ligneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl>: intriverat panes in alveolo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2082.2" n="II" level="1"> (In Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll., as <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: alveolum: tabula aleatoria.) <hi rend="ital">A small gaming-board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which the dice were thrown</hi> (cf. alveus, C.), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20</bibl>: alveolum poscere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2082.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The small channel of a river</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2082.4" n="IV" level="1"> And from its shape, <hi rend="ital">a weaver's shuttle</hi> (cf. Germ. Schiff), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alveus: <entryFree id="n2083" type="main" key="alve^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (alveum, <gen>n.</gen>, ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. naustibulum, p. 169 Müll.) [alvus], <sense id="n2083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cavity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2083.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosae ilicis alveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 453</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2083.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n2083.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tray;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a deep cavity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excavation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alveo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluitans alveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus scrobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:2 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 4, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2083.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hull of a ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveos navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvei navium quassati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a small ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skiff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavatus ex materiā alveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipit alveo Aeneam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2083.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hollowed gaming-board</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus cum tesseris lusorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveo et calculis vacare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>, n. 2.—</sense><sense id="n2083.6" n="D" level="2"> = alvus and alvearium, <hi rend="ital">a beehive</hi> (in Pliny, alvus (Jan), q. v. II. C.): <cit><quote lang="la">gens universa totius alvei consumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:4" default="NO">9, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2083.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bathing-tub</hi>: in balneum venit ... ut in alveum descenderet, etc., Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2083.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The channel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bed of a river</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis alveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis Ritu feruntur, nunc medio alveo Cum pace delabentis etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam citus aeque Tusco denatat alveo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit> Müll. (not elsewhere): <cit><quote lang="la">pleno alveo fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveo navigabile perfodere angustias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a canal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per crepidinem alvei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reversae sunt aquae in alveum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:4:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jos. 4, 18 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
alvus: <entryFree id="n2084" type="main" key="alvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">alvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 654</bibl> P.; 718 ib., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 193, 26</bibl>; Calv., Ael. Cin., and Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.) [for aluus from alo: venter feminae ab alendo dicta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll. and so Varr.; acc. to others kindr. with Sanscr. ulvam = uterus, and this again connected with vulva, volvo; <foreign lang="greek">e)lu/w ei)lu/w</foreign>; Sanscr. val = to turn; O. H. Germ. wallen = to roll], <sense id="n2084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the paunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the bowels.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatio alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan purgat alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exonerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non descendit alvus,</quote> <trans><tr>is costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui satis alvus reddit cotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>, n. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus cita,</quote> <trans><tr>active</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum bonam facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adstringere alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so also: cohibere, comprimere, supprimere, firmare, sistere, inhibere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constipate</hi>, etc.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eliciendas alvos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, for <hi rend="ital">excrement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus varia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus liquida, nigra, pallida, pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; and for <hi rend="ital">flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diarrhœa</hi>: alvus corpus ac vires <cb n="AMAL" /> carpit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2084.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2084.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The womb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alvo gestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">twice in Cic.: cum praegnans Dionysium alvo contineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes in alvo commendata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:340 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 340 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2084.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the digestive organs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 651</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2084.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beehive</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">mediā alvo, quā introeant apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi melle plenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 43, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si plenae alvi fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) alvo se continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:7" default="NO">9, 14, 7</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2084.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of the basin of the molten sea in the Jewish temple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(boves) alvum maris circuibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
alyattes: <entryFree id="n2085" type="main" key="A^ly^attes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălyattes</orth>, <itype>is or ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)alua/tths</foreign>, <sense id="n2085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Crœsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>: regnum Alyattei, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alymon: <entryFree id="n2086" type="main" key="A^ly_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălȳmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)alu/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n2086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">father of Iphimedia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alypon: <entryFree id="n2087" type="greek" key="a^ly_po^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălȳpŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/lupon</foreign>, <sense id="n2087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: acc. to Spreng., Globularia alypum, Linn.; <hi rend="ital">herb terrible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 7, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alysson: <entryFree id="n2088" type="greek" key="a^lysso^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălyssŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/lussos</foreign>, curing (canine) madness</etym>, <sense id="n2088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant used for the bite of a mad dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 57, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alytarcha: <entryFree id="n2089" type="greek" key="a^ly^tarcha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ălytarcha</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)luta/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n2089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate who superintended religious exhibitions</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 1, 12.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ălytarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the office of such magistrate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 36, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
alyzia: <entryFree id="n2090" type="main" key="A^lyzi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălyzĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ălyzēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aluzi/a</foreign>, Thuc. and Strabo; <foreign lang="greek">*)alu/zeia</foreign>, Steph. Byz., <sense id="n2090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Acarnania with a temple dedicated to Hercules</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kandili</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Alyziam accesseramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acarnanum urbes, Alyzia, Stratos etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Mann. Greece, 76 and 77.</sense></entryFree>
am: <entryFree id="n2091" type="main" key="am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">am-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">am</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos>, v. ambi-.</entryFree>
ama: <entryFree id="n2092" type="main" key="a^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. hama.</entryFree>
amabilis: <entryFree id="n2093" type="main" key="a^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amo</etym>, <sense id="n2093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves to be loved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amiable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis bella es atque amabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 84</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 54</bibl>: nec sine te (sc. Venere) fit laetum neque amabile quicquam, <hi rend="ital">without thee nothing lovely is obtained</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiolam tuam et amo et amabilem esse certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum amabilem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Prov. 18, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabilior mihi Velia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabilissimum nodum amicitiae tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabilis insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu condis amabile carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>or dost build the lovely rhyme</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocavit ejus nomen Amabilis - Domino,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jedidiah</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 12, 25</bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămābĭlĭter</orth>; in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">lovingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amiably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si amabiliter in me cogitare vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectet amabilius juvenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusit,</quote> <trans><tr>pleasantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amabilitas: <entryFree id="n2094" type="main" key="a^ma_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amabilis</etym>, <sense id="n2094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amiableness</hi> (only ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si amabilitas nostra tibi placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui amabilitati animum adiceret,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted himself to loveliness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence in late Latin as a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amabilitatem tuam litteras mitto,</quote> <trans><tr>to your Amiability</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amabiliter: <entryFree id="n2095" type="main" key="a^ma_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amabilis <sense id="n2095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amalthea: <entryFree id="n2096" type="main" key="A^malthe_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămalthēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ama/lqeia</foreign>. <sense id="n2096.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Melissus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fed Jupiter with goat's milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 139" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 139</bibl>.—Acc. to others, Amalthea is <hi rend="ital">the name of the goat itself</hi>, one of whose horns, accidentally broken off, was placed among the stars as the Cornu Amaltheae, or Cornu copiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:12" default="NO">3, 12</bibl>. From this horn nectar and ambrosia are said to have flowed; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, it was the emblem of plenty,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 28</bibl>.—Hence, meton.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămal-thēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămalthēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; in Cic., <hi rend="ital">the name of a library</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">an old sanctuary of Amalthea near the villa of Atticus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned with inscriptions</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">by Atticus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in imitation of which Cicero made a similar one at Arpinum</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Amalthea mea te exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n2096.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of the Cumœan sibyl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quidquid Amalthea dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 72</bibl>. <cb n="AMAR" /></sense></entryFree>
amandatio: <entryFree id="n2097" type="hapax" key="a_manda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmandātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amando</etym>, <sense id="n2097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">relegatio atque amandatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amando: <entryFree id="n2098" type="main" key="a_mando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-mando</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> (commonly with the access. idea of contempt; <cit><quote lang="la">in the anteAug. per. only in Cic., and freq.): an amandārat hunc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit> Matth.: <cit><quote lang="la">amandat hominem quo? Lilybaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amandati et repudiati coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. p. 205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. Fragm. p. 205</bibl></cit> Beier; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quir. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
amanienses: <entryFree id="n2099" type="hapax" key="A^ma_ni^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămānĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Amanus</etym>, <sense id="n2099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the mountain Amanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amans: <entryFree id="n2100" type="main" key="a^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămans</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos> and <sense id="n2100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. amo.</sense></entryFree>
amanter: <entryFree id="n2101" type="main" key="a^manter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>amo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
amantia: <entryFree id="n2102" type="main" key="A^manti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amanti/a</foreign>, Ptol., <sense id="n2102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of two towns of Illyricum</hi>, one inland, and the other on the coast, now <hi rend="ital">Nivitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămantĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămantīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amanuensis: <entryFree id="n2103" type="main" key="a_ma^nu^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmănŭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ab-manus</etym>, <sense id="n2103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clerk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi>, a manu servus (cf. ab, II. B. z. p.), only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 3</bibl> and Ner. 44.</sense></entryFree>
amanus: <entryFree id="n2104" type="main" key="A^ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range</hi>, <hi rend="ital">running from N.E. to S. W.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Syria and Cilicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jawur Dagh;</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămā-nĭcae pylae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the passes of Amanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 18, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:244 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 244 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
amaracinus: <entryFree id="n2105" type="main" key="a^ma_ra^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārăcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amaracus</etym>, <sense id="n2105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of marjoram</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārăcĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. unguentum), <hi rend="ital">marjoram ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 847</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1173" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1173</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">odious to swine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 974</bibl></cit>; hence the proverb: nihil cum amaracino sui, of people who will have nothing to do with a thing, Gell. praef. 19.</sense></entryFree>
amaracus: <entryFree id="n2106" type="greek" key="a^ma_ra^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāră-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ma/rakos</foreign>, and -<foreign lang="greek">on</foreign>, <sense id="n2106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marjoram</hi>: Origanum majorana, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave olens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 693</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amarantus: <entryFree id="n2107" type="greek" key="a^ma^rantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămărantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ma/rantos</foreign> (unfading), <sense id="n2107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amaranth</hi>: Celosia cristata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 23, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:439" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amare: <entryFree id="n2108" type="main" key="a^ma_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amarus.</entryFree>
amaresco: <entryFree id="n2109" type="hapax" key="a^ma_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n2109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [as if from amareo; <cit><quote lang="la">amarus],</quote> <trans><tr>to become bitter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amarico: <entryFree id="n2110" type="main" key="a^ma_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>amarus</etym>, <sense id="n2110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bitter</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n2110.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(liber) faciet amaricari ventrem tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2110.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to irritate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce repulsi sunt, qui amaricant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enn. in Psa. 65" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enn. in Psa. 65</bibl></cit>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
amaritas: <entryFree id="n2111" type="hapax" key="a^ma_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amarus</etym>, <sense id="n2111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
amariter: <entryFree id="n2112" type="main" key="a^ma_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amarus.</entryFree>
amarities: <entryFree id="n2113" type="hapax" key="a^ma_ri^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amarus</etym>, <sense id="n2113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcem curis miscet amaritiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
