amaritudo: <entryFree id="n2114" type="main" key="a^ma_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitterness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2114.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of taste (opp. dulcedo; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or the poets),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 92, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:125" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 77, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:105" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 64, § 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mara, id est, Amaritudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2114.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrimoniousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in bilem et amaritudinem vertat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: quantum illis (versibus) leporis, dulcedinis, amaritudinis, amoris! id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:169" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 169</bibl></cit> Spald. in amaritudine animi meae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 38, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Thren. 1, 4</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum frons hilaris, multis intus amaritudinibus (i. e. miseriis) referta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 31, 21</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
amaror: <entryFree id="n2115" type="main" key="a^ma_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the preced.; <cit><quote lang="la">rare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:930" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 930</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 247</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amarulentus: <entryFree id="n2116" type="main" key="a^ma_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of bitterness.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, Timon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicacitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
amarus: <entryFree id="n2117" type="main" key="a^ma_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">w)mo/s</foreign>; Sanscr. āmas = raw, amlas = sour; Germ. Ampfer = sorrel, Curtius; cf. Heb. <foreign />, mar = bitter</etym>, <sense id="n2117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitter</hi> (syn. acerbus). </sense><sense id="n2117.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of tasto (opp. dulcis): <cit><quote lang="la">absinthi latex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 941</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4</bibl>, <pb n="101" /> <cb n="AMAT" /> 15: <cit><quote lang="la">amara atque aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensusjudicat dulce, amarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salices,</quote> <trans><tr>pungent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: Doris amara, <hi rend="ital">brackish</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans><tr>bitter taste in the mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices amariores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>harsh wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae amarissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2117.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2117.3" n="1" level="3"> Of the hearing, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi> (cf. acer): <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:553" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 553</bibl></cit>, and, </sense><sense id="n2117.4" n="2" level="3"> Of smell, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus amarus odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2117.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2117.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Calamitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">amara dies et nectis amarior umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">amara mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores dulces aut amari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarissimae leges necessitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaritudo mea amarissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 38, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitter things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et amara laeto Temperet risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara curarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2117.7" n="B" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">biting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrimonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sarcastic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis amaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:900" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 900</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2117.8" n="C" level="2"> Of conduct, <hi rend="ital">morose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill - natured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritable</hi>: mulieres, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amariorem me senectus facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterly</hi>, in three forms: </sense><sense id="n2117.9" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 26, 75</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n2117.10" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămā-rĭter</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2117.11" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămārum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
amaryllis: <entryFree id="n2118" type="main" key="A^ma^ryllis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăryllis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Amaryllida; <case>voc.</case> Amarylli), = <foreign lang="greek">*)amarulli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a shepherdess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
amarynthis: <entryFree id="n2119" type="main" key="A^ma^rynthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămărynthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Amarynthus</etym>, <sense id="n2119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Diana;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
amarynthus: <entryFree id="n2120" type="main" key="A^ma^rynthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămărynthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ama/runqos</foreign>, <sense id="n2120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village of Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Diana;</hi> hence called <hi rend="ital">Amarynthis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 38</bibl>; cf. Mann. Graec. 261.</sense></entryFree>
amasco: <entryFree id="n2121" type="gloss" key="a^masco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n2121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [amo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to love</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 334</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
amasenus: <entryFree id="n2122" type="main" key="A^ma^se_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăsēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eastward from the Pontine Marshes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Amaseno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 685</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 626; Müll. Röms Camp. 2, 235.</sense></entryFree>
amasia: <entryFree id="n2123" type="main" key="A^ma^si_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăsīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ama/seia</foreign>, <sense id="n2123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Iris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Strabo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3, 4, § 10</bibl>; cf. Mann. Asia Minor, 2, 461 sq.</sense></entryFree>
amasio: <entryFree id="n2124" type="main" key="a^ma_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = amasius, <sense id="n2124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover</hi> (only post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 20</bibl> Elm.; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef</foreign>. 10, 181.</sense></entryFree>
amasis: <entryFree id="n2125" type="main" key="A^ma_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/amasis</foreign>, <sense id="n2125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amasiunculus: <entryFree id="n2126" type="main" key="a^ma_si^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāsĭuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>amasio</etym>, <sense id="n2126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fond lover</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45, 75</bibl>. (Not found elsewhere.)</sense></entryFree>
amasius: <entryFree id="n2127" type="main" key="a^ma_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămāsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>amo</etym>, <sense id="n2127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover</hi> (syn. amator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9" default="NO">19, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amastris: <entryFree id="n2128" type="main" key="A^mastris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămastris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/amastris</foreign>, <sense id="n2128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Paphlagonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the shore of the Pontus Euxinus</hi>, orig. called Sesamum, now <hi rend="ital">Amasserah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; cf. Mann. Asia Minor, 3, 25 sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămastrĭă-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Amastris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:331" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 331</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămastrĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Amastris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amata: <entryFree id="n2129" type="main" key="A^ma_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n2129.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of King Latinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Lavinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 343</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2129.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a vestal virgin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amathus: <entryFree id="n2130" type="main" key="A^ma^thu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăthūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amaqou=s</foreign> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. Amathunta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 220</bibl>), <sense id="n2130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the southern part of Cyprus</hi>, consisting of two ports, one on the coast, now <hi rend="ital">Old Limasol</hi>, and the other on a hill inland, now <hi rend="ital">Agios Tychanos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 220</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">sacred to Venus</hi>, who is hence called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăthūsĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămăthūsĭă-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Amathus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 227</bibl></cit> Merk. (Heins. reads <hi rend="ital">Amathusiadas</hi>, from Amathusias, ădis.)</sense></entryFree>
amatio: <entryFree id="n2131" type="main" key="a^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amo</etym>, <sense id="n2131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondling</hi> (perh. only in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">tua mihi odiosa est amatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 5, 14</bibl>: neque in hac (fabulā) amatio, <hi rend="ital">intrigue</hi>, id. Capt. epil. 2.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amator: <entryFree id="n2132" type="main" key="a^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n2132.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend</hi>, in an honorable sense (syn.: amans, amicus, studiosus): vir bonus amatorque <cb n="AMBA" /> noster, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis, Ruris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; so, sapientiae, Cic. Tim. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatores Catoni desunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>readers of his writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit> (cf. just before: Catonem quis nostrorum oratorum legit?).—</sense><sense id="n2132.1" n="II" level="1"> In a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">a lover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paramour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 28</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: Philocomasio amator (<case>dat.</case> for Philocomasii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter an amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est amatorem esse, aliud amantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 38 al.</bibl>—* Used as <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatores oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
amatorculus: <entryFree id="n2133" type="hapax" key="a^ma_torcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātorcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>amator</etym>, <sense id="n2133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorry lover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amatorie: <entryFree id="n2134" type="main" key="a^ma_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amatorius.</entryFree>
amatorius: <entryFree id="n2135" type="main" key="a^ma_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amator</etym>, <sense id="n2135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to love</hi> (sensual), <hi rend="ital">amatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui voluptate amatoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anacreontis tota poësis amatoria est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus,</quote> <trans><tr>a love-potion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 79</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămā-tōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a means of exciting love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a philter</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">fi/ltron</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 52, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi monstrabo amatorium: si vis amari, ama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:2 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 2 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">amorously</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 20</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amatrix: <entryFree id="n2136" type="main" key="a^ma_tri^x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātrĭx</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female lover</hi>, in an honorable and a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweetheart</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">amans, amica): Sappho amatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:69:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 69, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 25</bibl>.—Used as <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatrices aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>amorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:4" default="NO">10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amaturio: <entryFree id="n2137" type="gloss" key="a^ma_tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămātŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n2137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">verb. desid.</hi> [amo], <hi rend="ital">to wish to love</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 825</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
amazon: <entryFree id="n2138" type="main" key="A^ma_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāzon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amazw/n</foreign>, <number>plur.</number> Amazones [a Scythian word of dub. signif.; acc. to an etymological fancy, as if from <foreign lang="greek">a)-mazo/s</foreign>, without breast; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl>, relates that their right breast was removed in childhood, to enable them to handle the bow more conveniently], <sense id="n2138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Amazon;</hi> and <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">Amazons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who dwelt on the river Thermodon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2138.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threiciae Amazones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultat Amazon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazon Mavortia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:89" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peltata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 218 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 218 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2138.2" n="II" level="1"> Metaph., <hi rend="ital">a heroine of love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 743</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2138.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāzŏnĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Amazonian</hi>, Mel.1, 19, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2138.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāzŏ-nis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Amazon, <hi rend="ital">an Amazon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazonidum agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazonidum gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazonidum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:13:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 13, 13</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">title of a poem composed by a poet named Marsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:29:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 29, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2138.5" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămāzŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Amazonicus, <hi rend="ital">Amazonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 237" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 237</bibl></cit>: vir Amazonius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hippolytus</hi>, the son of an Amazon by Theseus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amb: <entryFree id="n2139" type="main" key="amb"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-</orth>, v. ambi-.</entryFree>
ambactus: <entryFree id="n2140" type="main" key="ambactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambactus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celt. amb; Goth. andbahti = service; andbahts = servant</etym>, <sense id="n2140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vassal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dependent upon a lord</hi>: ambactus apud Ennium linguā Gallicā servus appellatur. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimos circum se ambactos clientesque habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. Grimm, Gram. 2, p. 211; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Antiq. p. 304</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambadedo: <entryFree id="n2141" type="main" key="amba^de^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-ăd-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gnaw around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat up entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris dotem ambadedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit> and 17.</sense></entryFree>
ambages: <entryFree id="n2142" type="main" key="amba_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> and <sense id="n2142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> dub., though mentioned in <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 25</bibl> P. and found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl> MS.; but found in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:227" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 227</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">ambagine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 304</bibl></cit>; the <number>plur.</number> is complete, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ambagum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 761</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. II. p. 403</bibl>) [ambi-ago], <hi rend="ital">a going round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a roundabout way</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose only postAug.; syn.: ambago, sinus, flexus, circuitus). </sense><sense id="n2142.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: variarum ambage viarum (of the <hi rend="ital">windings</hi> of the labyrinth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 161</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos tecti ambagesque resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Luna) multiformi ambage torsit ingenia contemplantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum ambages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis ambagibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2142.2" n="II" level="1"> Of speech. </sense><sense id="n2142.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Circumlocution</hi>,<cb n="AMBI" />  <hi rend="ital">evasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">digression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambages mitte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 10</bibl> (not elsewh. in Plaut.): ambages mihi Narrare occipit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambages et longa exorsa tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te longis ambagibus morer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis ambagibus,</quote> <trans><tr>without circumlocution</tr>, <tr>directly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2142.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Obscurity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguity</hi> (as kindr. with ambiguus).—So of the Theban Sphinx: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor ambagum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 761</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 261</bibl>.—Of the lang. of oracles: <cit><quote lang="la">ambage nexa Arcana tegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 218" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā ambage Chalcedonii monstrabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 54</bibl>.—Also transf. to actions: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambages,</quote> <trans><tr>in an obscure</tr>, <tr>enigmatical manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 53, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambagiosus: <entryFree id="n2143" type="hapax" key="amba_gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambāgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ambages</etym>, <sense id="n2143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of windings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">digressions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica atque ambagiosa conjectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:33" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ambago: <entryFree id="n2144" type="hapax" key="amba_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = ambages: rerum. <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 303</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 297</bibl>.</entryFree>
ambarvalis: <entryFree id="n2145" type="gloss" key="ambarva_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambarvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ambi-arvum</etym>, <sense id="n2145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that goes around the fields</hi>: ambarvales hostiae dicebantur, quae pro arvis a duobus fratribus sacrificabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 5</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambarvale sacrificium dicitur, quod arva ambiat victima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 3, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. arvalis.</sense></entryFree>
ambaxio: <entryFree id="n2146" type="gloss" key="ambaxio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambaxio</orth>: catervatim, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 26</bibl> Müll. [amb-ago].</entryFree>
ambecisus: <entryFree id="n2147" type="hapax" key="ambe^ci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĕcīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ambi-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n2147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rounding off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilia dicta ab ambecisu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 43</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ambe: <entryFree id="n2148" type="main" key="ambe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambe-</orth>, insepar. <pos>prep.</pos>, v. ambi-.</entryFree>
ambedo: <entryFree id="n2149" type="main" key="ambe^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n2149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi> ambest, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gnaw around</hi>, and with an extension of the idea (cf.: adedo, aduro, accīdo), <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (very rare; not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 396</bibl>, where the correct read. is <hi rend="ital">lambens;</hi> v. Lachm. ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">flammis ambesa Robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambesas absumere mensas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis locustarum ambederat quidquid herbidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambestrix: <entryFree id="n2150" type="hapax" key="ambestrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambestrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ambedo</etym>, <sense id="n2150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female consumer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursae saevae hominis ambestrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ambesus: <entryFree id="n2151" type="main" key="ambe_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambēsus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ambedo.</entryFree>
ambi: <entryFree id="n2152" type="main" key="ambi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambi-</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ambe-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 30</bibl> Müll.); abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-, am-, an-</orth>. <sense id="n2152.0" n="I" level="1"> Insepar. <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>Osc. amfr-; Umbr. am-, an-, ampr-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/</foreign>; old Sax. umbi; old Germ. umpi; mod. Germ. um = around; Sanscr. abhi = around</etym>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round about;</hi> used only in composition; before vowels usually amb-: ambages, ambedo, ambigo, ambio, amburo; but amicio (for amjicio); once also amp-: ampulla; before consonants, ambi-: ambidens, ambifariam, ambivium; am-: amplector, amputo, amsegetes, amtermini; or amp-: ampsanctus; but before <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">q</hi>, <hi rend="ital">h</hi>, <hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, an-: anceps, ancisus, anquiro, anhelo (q. v.), anhelus, anfractus, etc.—</sense><sense id="n2152.1" n="II" level="1"> Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">am</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">an</orth>, arch. <pos>prep.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">am fines, am segetes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 205</bibl></cit> P.: an terminum, Cato, Orig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 1, 14, 5</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. I. p. 535 sq.</bibl>; Kühner, Ausf. Gr. § 210, 8; Hand, Turs. I. pp. 284 sq.</sense></entryFree>
ambidens: <entryFree id="n2153" type="gloss" key="ambi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭ-dens</orth>, <sense id="n2153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sheep which has both upper and lower teeth</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ambienter: <entryFree id="n2154" type="hapax" key="ambi^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>as if from ambiens, which is not in use</etym>, <sense id="n2154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ambifariam: <entryFree id="n2155" type="main" key="ambi^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭfārĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n2155.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ambifarius: <entryFree id="n2156" type="main" key="ambi^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭ-fārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di-fa/sios, tri-fa/sios</foreign>, and v. aliquot-fariam</etym>, <sense id="n2156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has two sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of double meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi> (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> p. 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 182</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2156.1" n="1" level="3"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭfārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2156.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭfārĭ-am</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (orig. <hi rend="ital">acc. fem.</hi> sc. partem), <hi rend="ital">on two sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguously</hi>, = in utramque partem, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18, p. 360, 25</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 276, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambiformiter: <entryFree id="n2157" type="main" key="ambi^formi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭ-formĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>forma</etym>, = ambigue, ambifarie, <sense id="n2157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ambiguously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> p. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambiga: <entryFree id="n2158" type="main" key="ambi_ga^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambīgă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/mbic, i=kos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n2158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cap of a still</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 7</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7</bibl>, it is written as Greek.</sense></entryFree>
ambigo: <entryFree id="n2159" type="main" key="ambi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n2159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. tense</hi> not used), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>. </sense><sense id="n2159.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigens patriam et declinans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6</bibl></cit>, <pb n="102" /> <cb n="AMBI" /> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n2159.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wander about; to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in suspense</hi> (syn. dubito; class., but mostly in prose).—In this sense in Cic. either <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2159.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quale quid sit, ambigitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is uncertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis res eandem habet naturam ambigendi, de quā disceptari potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>admits of arguments for and against</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigitur, quotiens uter utro sit prior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nomine ipso ambigi video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspici aliquando eam volucrem, non ambigitur,</quote> <trans><tr>it cannot be doubted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2159.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Personal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei primum occurreret, ambigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum regnum Asiae occupaturum haud ambigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, de quā tu ambigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigebant de illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2159.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigitur status, in quo etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1074</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo jure, quod ambigitur inter peritissimos,</quote> <trans><tr>of which there is a doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eis causis, quae propter scriptum ambiguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2159.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2159.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debate about something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter eos, qui ambigunt, conveniat, quid sit id, de quo agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigere de vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2159.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangle</hi>, etc.: vicini nostri ambigunt de finibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigunt agnati cum eo, qui est heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hereditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ambigue: <entryFree id="n2160" type="main" key="ambi^gu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭgŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ambiguus <sense id="n2160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ambiguitas: <entryFree id="n2161" type="main" key="ambi^gu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭgŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ambiguus</etym>, <sense id="n2161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equivocalness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nobis ambiguitas nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ambiguitatem incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:47" default="NO">6, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:3" default="NO">7, 9, 3</bibl>: omne quod (vir) loquitur, sine ambiguitate venit, <hi rend="ital">cometh to pass without uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 6</bibl> al.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis ambiguitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambiguus: <entryFree id="n2162" type="main" key="ambi^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ambigo</etym>, <sense id="n2162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hither and thither.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2162.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambiguum favorem gratiam victoris spectare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in that they show equal friendliness to both sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus Proteus,</quote> <trans><tr>who sometimes takes one form</tr>, <tr>sometimes another</tr>, <tr>changeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus fuerit, modo vir, modo femina, Scython,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:280" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inque virum soliti vultus mutare ferinos Ambigui prosecta lupi,</quote> <trans><tr>they sometimes assume the form of a wolf and sometimes that of a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promisit Ambiguam Salamina, h. l. = alteram,</quote> <trans><tr>a second Salamis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n2162.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2162.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi> (syn.: dubius, incertus): ambiguum est quod in ambas agi partes animo potest. Hujusmodi apud Graecos <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/bola</foreign> dicuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid incerti mihi in animo prius aut ambiguom fuit, Nunc liquet, nunc defaecatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: etiam si dudum fuerat ambiguom hoc mihi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile et ambiguum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ambiguus rex, i. e. sine dubio rex futurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭgŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ambiguo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ambiguo relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1133</bibl></cit>: non habui ambiguum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servet in ambiguo Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sane alias magis in ambiguo Britannia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">acc. absol.</hi> in the Gr. manner: Ambiguum Clymene precibus Phaëthontis an irā Mota magis, <hi rend="ital">it being uncertain whether</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 765</bibl> (so, incertum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n2162.4" n="B" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ambigua distinximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 12, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭgŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark saying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguorum complura sunt genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 26, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 61, 250</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2162.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavering; not to be relied on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy.</hi> —So of moral conduct: <cit><quote lang="la">esse ambiguā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer acris ingenii sed ambigui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina bonis atque honestis moribus, non ambiguā pudicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ambiguas vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum timet ambiguam Tyriosque bilinguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 1, 661</bibl></cit>.—Of fortune, <hi rend="ital">changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluctuating</hi>:<cb n="AMBI" />  ambiguarum rerum sciens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl>.!*? In Tac. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus imperandi,</quote> <trans><tr>irresolute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris ac metus,</quote> <trans><tr>wavering between shame and fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭguē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">doubtfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>with doubtful success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ambio: <entryFree id="n2163" type="main" key="ambi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amb-ĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, and ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n2163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (although from the root eo, it is regularly conjugated throughout; hence <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> ambītus; but ambitio and 2. ambĭtus follow the quantity of the simple verb, eo, ĭtum; in the <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> ambiebat; <cit><quote lang="la">also ambibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 361</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 910</bibl> P.; Zumpt, Gram. § 215). </sense><sense id="n2163.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to go round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about a thing</hi> (syn. circumeo): <cit><quote lang="la">ut terram lunae cursus proxime ambiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambibat Siculae cautus fundamina terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet urbem ambiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 592</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2163.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdo, cingo): insula, quam amnis Euphrates ambiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:101" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitae litora terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracam nec purior ambiat Hebrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 550</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 5</bibl>: flumina campos cingentia; <cit><quote lang="la">v. ambitus, I.): funiculus ambiebat gyrum ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros praealtum mare ambiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(clipei) oras ambiit auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiente (gemmam) circulo coloris aurei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judam suo ambiebat exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 13, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2163.4" n="B" level="2"> T. t. to designate the manner in which candidates for office sought to procure votes (v. ambitio), <hi rend="ital">to go round after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to solicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canvass for votes</hi> (syn. peto): <cit><quote lang="la">virtute ambire oportet, non fautoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si comitia placet in senatu habere, petamus, ambiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiuntur, rogantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos ex senatu ambiundo nitebantur, ne etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of the office: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2163.5" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to solicit</hi> one for something, for his favor, friendship, etc., <hi rend="ital">to strive for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to gain</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">peto, sector): qui ambīssent palmam histrionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 69</bibl></cit>: nisi senis amicos oras, ambis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reginam ambire affatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubiis ambire Latinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te pauper ambit sollicitā prece Ruris colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiebat Jason summum sacerdotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambienti, ut legibus solveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambirent multi, ne filias in sortem darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec ultro ambiretur consulatum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci, qui ob nobilitatem plurimis nuptiis ambiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ambiorix: <entryFree id="n2164" type="main" key="Ambio^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ambiŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief of the Eburones in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26 sq.</bibl>, 5, 38 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ambitio: <entryFree id="n2165" type="main" key="ambi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ambio</etym>, <sense id="n2165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going round.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2165.1" n="I" level="1"> In the time of the republic, t. t. (v. ambio, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">the going about of candidates for office in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the soliciting of individual citizens for their vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a canvassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suing for office</hi> (by just and lawful means; <cit><quote lang="la">while ambitus denotes unlawful means, as bribery, threats, etc.): quid de nostris ambitionibus loquar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea me ambitio ab omni illā cogitatione abstrahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ambitionis nostrae tempora postulabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si infinitus forensium rerum labor et ambitionis occupatio decursu honorum etiam aetatis flexu constitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic magistratus a populo summā ambitione contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:53:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 53, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta exarsit ambitio, ut primores civitatis prensarent homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2165.2" n="II. A." level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a striving for one's favor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">good-will; an excessive desire to please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:244" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliquā suspitione sive ambitione adducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Scipione ambitio major, vita tristior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl></cit> Heus., Beier, and Gernh.: Dionysius Platonem magnā ambitione Syracusas perduxit, <hi rend="ital">in an ostentatious manner</hi>, for the purpose of securing his favor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 2</bibl> Br. and Dähn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitio (i.e. studium Fabiis placendi) obstabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione relegatā,</quote> <trans><tr>without flattery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 84</bibl></cit>: ambitionem<cb n="AMBI" />  scriptoris facile averseris, obtrectatio et livor pronis auribus accipiuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo officii aut ambitionis genere omisso, i.e. nullis blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronas quam parcissime et sine ambitione tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, also <hi rend="ital">partiality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus sibi per ambitionem dictum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2165.3" n="B" level="2"> With the predom. idea of the purpose or end, <hi rend="ital">a desire for honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popularity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, etc.; in bon. part., <hi rend="ital">ambition;</hi> in mal. part., <hi rend="ital">vanity.</hi>—So in Lucr. of the ambitious efforts of men: <cit><quote lang="la">Angustum per iter luctantes ambitionis,</quote> <trans><tr>struggling to press through the narrow way of ambition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ambitio quaedam ad honorum studium duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miserrima omnino est ambitio honorumque contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo incepto studioque me ambitio mala detinuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ab avaritiā aut miserā ambitione laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitā solutorum miserā ambitione gravique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 129</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 78</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6, 18: inanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:103 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 103 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet ipsa vitium sit ambitio, tamen frequenter causa virtutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funerum nulla ambitio,</quote> <trans><tr>no display</tr>, <tr>pomp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2165.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Great exertion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum admitti magnā ambitione aegre obtinuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2165.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which surrounds</hi> (v. ambio, 2.; <cit><quote lang="la">postclass. for ambitus): vimineos alveos circumdant ambitione tergorum bubulorum,</quote> <trans><tr>with a wrapping of cowhide</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuliginem ambitio extimae cutis cohibet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 35</bibl></cit>: ita assedimus, ut me ex tribus medium lateris ambitione protegerent, Min. Oct. 4.</sense></entryFree>
ambitiosus: <entryFree id="n2166" type="main" key="ambi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ambĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ambitio</etym>. <sense id="n2166.0" n="I" level="1"> (Very rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <hi rend="ital">Going round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompassing;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twining round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivis hederis ambitiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 20</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">undique ambientibus ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>).—Of a river, <hi rend="ital">making circuits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having many windings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jordanes amnis ambitiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl></cit>.— Of oratorical ornament, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus ambitiosa recidet Ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2166.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2166.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That asks for a thing fawningly;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">that solicits the favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">of any one</hi>, in a good and bad sense, <hi rend="ital">honor-loving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courting favor; vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainglorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceited</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita sit ambitiosus, ut omnes vos nosque cotidie persalutet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo minime ambitiosus, minime in rogando molestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte me in Graecos tam ambitiosum factum esse mirere,</quote> <trans><tr>desirous of the favor of the Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro nostris ut sis ambitiosa malis, Ov P. 3, 1, 84: pro nato caerula mater Ambitiosa suo fuit,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>begs fawningly of Vulcan for weapons for her son</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis artibus ambitiosus,</quote> <trans><tr>seeking to ingratiate one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubris magis princeps quam ambitiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2166.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is willingly solicited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entreated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambitious; much sought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosus et qui ambit et qui ambitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba caelestes ambitiosa sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:298" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexus muliebris saevus, ambitiosus, potestatis avidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: si locuples hostis est, avari; <cit><quote lang="la">si pauper, ambitiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota quidem sed non ambitiosa domus,</quote> <trans><tr>not sought after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit> Jahn: ambitiosae pulchritudinis scortum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2166.4" n="C" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentatious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>founded merely on the desire to please</tr>, <tr>interested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author>
